intro: Chomelia fragrans, commonly known as the sweet sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds. Chomelia fragrans is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical uses in traditional medicine.
